result.execSummary:
The defendant Briana L. Shilts was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Identity Theft, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**3 days credit, if revoked** 
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: 20CF1099

miscConds.notes: 08/01/2022: PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.
AODA and follow through with recommendations.

No contact with J.T.

08/01/2022: Per order dated 7/21/22  Restitution is now $0.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Briana L. Shilts

records.addlTxt: Letter sent to defendant regarding DOC to COC Collects. Includes 20CF1099, 22CF383
AMENDED - Restitution now $0 - Clerk of Courts to Collect.

Amendment to Judgment of Conviction.
Restitution -0- None Requested

(Cases 20CF1099, 22CF383 are called at 3:22 PM) Defendant Briana L. Shilts in court. Attorney Alicia Linzmeier in court for Briana L. Shilts. Attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for State of Wisconsin.  
Victim/Witness statute complied with. Defense recites the joint sentence recommendation. Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver in 22CF383. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Defendant pleads No Contest to 22CF383 Count 1- Identity Theft. Court accepts plea and finds the Defendant guilty. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in. Court orders in 20CF1099 the DAGP is revoked and Court finds the Defendant guilty. State will file Information. 
Court withholds sentence and orders 2 years Probation concurrent wit the following conditions: 60 days jail with Huber in 20CF1099, all stayed pending further order of the court; AODA and follow through with recommendations; No contact with J.T.; No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting; Restitution in 22CF383 to be determined within 60 days; Letter of apology to J.T. to be given to the agent; Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations; Maintain absolute sobriety; Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge; Court costs. 
Court orders 2 days credit if revoked in 20CF1099 and 3 days credit if revoked in 22CF383.

11:10 AM cases 20CF1099 and 22CF383 called. Prosecuting attorney Loralee Clark in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Briana L. Shilts appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Alicia Linzmeier appeared by video for Briana L. Shilts. Warrant is quashed, bond continues. A hearing is already scheduled on 7/15/2022 at 3:15 PM in branch 5.

Case called at 10:03 AM: 21CF1378, 20CF1099.
Defendant Briana L. Shilts not in court.  Attorney Alicia Linzmeier appeared for Briana Shilts..  Attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for State of Wisconsin.
10:04 AM-Off record for Attorney Linzmeier to call her client.  Case re-called at 10:04 AM. Attorney Linzmeier was unable to make contact with the Defendant.
State requests warrants. Warrants ordered.

(4:12 PM cases 20CF1099, 22CF383 called.) Prosecuting attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Briana L. Shilts in court. Attorney Alicia Linzmeier in court for Briana L. Shilts.
Court orders the warrants are quashed.
Attorney Linzmeier advises should be able to resolve the cases with one more court appearance.
Order to Show Cause Hearing in 20CF1099 and Hearing in 22CF383 scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 10 am.

(4:01 PM cases 20CF1099, 22CF383 called.) Prosecuting attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Briana L. Shilts does not appear in court or via Zoom. Attorney Alicia Linzmeier in court for Briana L. Shilts.
Attorney Linzmeier has no information for the defendant's non-appearance.
State requests warrants. Court orders warrants.

(11:35 AM cases 20CF1099, 22CF383 called.) Prosecuting attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Briana L. Shilts in court, in custody. Attorney Alicia Linzmeier in court for Briana L. Shilts.
Attorney Linzmeier advises was just appointed yesterday and received an offer from the State, requests additional time to go over everything with the defendant.
Order to Show Cause Hearing in 20CF1098 and Hearing in 22CF383 scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 4 pm.
